intro: Grammica indecora, commonly known as the false dandelion, is a flowering plant native to parts of Asia and Africa. It belongs to the Asteraceae family, which includes daisies and sunflowers, and is characterized by its composite flower heads. The plant features basal leaves that are usually lobed or toothed, and it produces small, yellow flowers that develop into fluffy, white seeds. Grammica indecora is often found in disturbed soils and can thrive in a variety of environmental conditions. Its botanical structure supports its role as a pioneer species in ecological succession.
